00455 unsigned int
00456         SOIL_load_OGL_cubemap_from_memory
00457         (
00458                 const unsigned char *const x_pos_buffer,
00459                 int x_pos_buffer_length,
00460                 const unsigned char *const x_neg_buffer,
00461                 int x_neg_buffer_length,
00462                 const unsigned char *const y_pos_buffer,
00463                 int y_pos_buffer_length,
00464                 const unsigned char *const y_neg_buffer,
00465                 int y_neg_buffer_length,
00466                 const unsigned char *const z_pos_buffer,
00467                 int z_pos_buffer_length,
00468                 const unsigned char *const z_neg_buffer,
00469                 int z_neg_buffer_length,
00470                 int force_channels,
00471                 unsigned int reuse_texture_ID,
00472                 unsigned int flags
00473         )
00474 {
00475         /*      variables       */
00476         unsigned char* img;
00477         int width, height, channels;
00478         unsigned int tex_id;
00479         /*      error checking  */
00480         if( (x_pos_buffer == NULL) ||
00481                 (x_neg_buffer == NULL) ||
00482                 (y_pos_buffer == NULL) ||
00483                 (y_neg_buffer == NULL) ||
00484                 (z_pos_buffer == NULL) ||
00485                 (z_neg_buffer == NULL) )
00486         {
00487                 result_string_pointer = "Invalid cube map buffers list";
00488                 return 0;
00489         }
00490         /*      capability checking     */
00491         if( query_cubemap_capability() != SOIL_CAPABILITY_PRESENT )
00492         {
00493                 result_string_pointer = "No cube map capability present";
00494                 return 0;
00495         }
00496         /*      1st face: try to load the image */
00497         img = SOIL_load_image_from_memory(
00498                         x_pos_buffer, x_pos_buffer_length,
00499                         &width, &height, &channels, force_channels );
00500         /*      channels holds the original number of channels, which may have been forced      */
00501         if( (force_channels >= 1) && (force_channels <= 4) )
00502         {
00503                 channels = force_channels;
00504         }
00505         if( NULL == img )
00506         {
00507                 /*      image loading failed    */
00508                 result_string_pointer = stbi_failure_reason();
00509                 return 0;
00510         }
00511         /*      upload the texture, and create a texture ID if necessary        */
00512         tex_id = SOIL_internal_create_OGL_texture(
00513                         img, width, height, channels,
00514                         reuse_texture_ID, flags,
00515                         SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP, SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X,
00516                         SOIL_MAX_CUBE_MAP_TEXTURE_SIZE );
00517         /*      and nuke the image data */
00518         SOIL_free_image_data( img );
00519         /*      continue?       */
00520         if( tex_id != 0 )
00521         {
00522                 /*      1st face: try to load the image */
00523                 img = SOIL_load_image_from_memory(
00524                                 x_neg_buffer, x_neg_buffer_length,
00525                                 &width, &height, &channels, force_channels );
00526                 /*      channels holds the original number of channels, which may have been forced      */
00527                 if( (force_channels >= 1) && (force_channels <= 4) )
00528                 {
00529                         channels = force_channels;
00530                 }
00531                 if( NULL == img )
00532                 {
00533                         /*      image loading failed    */
00534                         result_string_pointer = stbi_failure_reason();
00535                         return 0;
00536                 }
00537                 /*      upload the texture, but reuse the assigned texture ID   */
00538                 tex_id = SOIL_internal_create_OGL_texture(
00539                                 img, width, height, channels,
00540                                 tex_id, flags,
00541                                 SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP, SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X,
00542                                 SOIL_MAX_CUBE_MAP_TEXTURE_SIZE );
00543                 /*      and nuke the image data */
00544                 SOIL_free_image_data( img );
00545         }
00546         /*      continue?       */
00547         if( tex_id != 0 )
00548         {
00549                 /*      1st face: try to load the image */
00550                 img = SOIL_load_image_from_memory(
00551                                 y_pos_buffer, y_pos_buffer_length,
00552                                 &width, &height, &channels, force_channels );
00553                 /*      channels holds the original number of channels, which may have been forced      */
00554                 if( (force_channels >= 1) && (force_channels <= 4) )
00555                 {
00556                         channels = force_channels;
00557                 }
00558                 if( NULL == img )
00559                 {
00560                         /*      image loading failed    */
00561                         result_string_pointer = stbi_failure_reason();
00562                         return 0;
00563                 }
00564                 /*      upload the texture, but reuse the assigned texture ID   */
00565                 tex_id = SOIL_internal_create_OGL_texture(
00566                                 img, width, height, channels,
00567                                 tex_id, flags,
00568                                 SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP, SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y,
00569                                 SOIL_MAX_CUBE_MAP_TEXTURE_SIZE );
00570                 /*      and nuke the image data */
00571                 SOIL_free_image_data( img );
00572         }
00573         /*      continue?       */
00574         if( tex_id != 0 )
00575         {
00576                 /*      1st face: try to load the image */
00577                 img = SOIL_load_image_from_memory(
00578                                 y_neg_buffer, y_neg_buffer_length,
00579                                 &width, &height, &channels, force_channels );
00580                 /*      channels holds the original number of channels, which may have been forced      */
00581                 if( (force_channels >= 1) && (force_channels <= 4) )
00582                 {
00583                         channels = force_channels;
00584                 }
00585                 if( NULL == img )
00586                 {
00587                         /*      image loading failed    */
00588                         result_string_pointer = stbi_failure_reason();
00589                         return 0;
00590                 }
00591                 /*      upload the texture, but reuse the assigned texture ID   */
00592                 tex_id = SOIL_internal_create_OGL_texture(
00593                                 img, width, height, channels,
00594                                 tex_id, flags,
00595                                 SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP, SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y,
00596                                 SOIL_MAX_CUBE_MAP_TEXTURE_SIZE );
00597                 /*      and nuke the image data */
00598                 SOIL_free_image_data( img );
00599         }
00600         /*      continue?       */
00601         if( tex_id != 0 )
00602         {
00603                 /*      1st face: try to load the image */
00604                 img = SOIL_load_image_from_memory(
00605                                 z_pos_buffer, z_pos_buffer_length,
00606                                 &width, &height, &channels, force_channels );
00607                 /*      channels holds the original number of channels, which may have been forced      */
00608                 if( (force_channels >= 1) && (force_channels <= 4) )
00609                 {
00610                         channels = force_channels;
00611                 }
00612                 if( NULL == img )
00613                 {
00614                         /*      image loading failed    */
00615                         result_string_pointer = stbi_failure_reason();
00616                         return 0;
00617                 }
00618                 /*      upload the texture, but reuse the assigned texture ID   */
00619                 tex_id = SOIL_internal_create_OGL_texture(
00620                                 img, width, height, channels,
00621                                 tex_id, flags,
00622                                 SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP, SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z,
00623                                 SOIL_MAX_CUBE_MAP_TEXTURE_SIZE );
00624                 /*      and nuke the image data */
00625                 SOIL_free_image_data( img );
00626         }
00627         /*      continue?       */
00628         if( tex_id != 0 )
00629         {
00630                 /*      1st face: try to load the image */
00631                 img = SOIL_load_image_from_memory(
00632                                 z_neg_buffer, z_neg_buffer_length,
00633                                 &width, &height, &channels, force_channels );
00634                 /*      channels holds the original number of channels, which may have been forced      */
00635                 if( (force_channels >= 1) && (force_channels <= 4) )
00636                 {
00637                         channels = force_channels;
00638                 }
00639                 if( NULL == img )
00640                 {
00641                         /*      image loading failed    */
00642                         result_string_pointer = stbi_failure_reason();
00643                         return 0;
00644                 }
00645                 /*      upload the texture, but reuse the assigned texture ID   */
00646                 tex_id = SOIL_internal_create_OGL_texture(
00647                                 img, width, height, channels,
00648                                 tex_id, flags,
00649                                 SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP, SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z,
00650                                 SOIL_MAX_CUBE_MAP_TEXTURE_SIZE );
00651                 /*      and nuke the image data */
00652                 SOIL_free_image_data( img );
00653         }
00654         /*      and return the handle, such as it is    */
00655         return tex_id;
00656 }
00657 
00658 unsigned int
00659         SOIL_load_OGL_single_cubemap
00660         (
00661                 const char *filename,
00662                 const char face_order[6],
00663                 int force_channels,
00664                 unsigned int reuse_texture_ID,
00665                 unsigned int flags
00666         )
00667 {
00668         /*      variables       */
00669         unsigned char* img;
00670         int width, height, channels, i;
00671         unsigned int tex_id = 0;
00672         /*      error checking  */
00673         if( filename == NULL )
00674         {
00675                 result_string_pointer = "Invalid single cube map file name";
00676                 return 0;
00677         }
00678         /*      does the user want direct uploading of the image as a DDS file? */
00679         if( flags & SOIL_FLAG_DDS_LOAD_DIRECT )
00680         {
00681                 /*      1st try direct loading of the image as a DDS file
00682                         note: direct uploading will only load what is in the
00683                         DDS file, no MIPmaps will be generated, the image will
00684                         not be flipped, etc.    */
00685                 tex_id = SOIL_direct_load_DDS( filename, reuse_texture_ID, flags, 1 );
00686                 if( tex_id )
00687                 {
00688                         /*      hey, it worked!!        */
00689                         return tex_id;
00690                 }
00691         }
00692         /*      face order checking     */
00693         for( i = 0; i < 6; ++i )
00694         {
00695                 if( (face_order[i] != 'N') &&
00696                         (face_order[i] != 'S') &&
00697                         (face_order[i] != 'W') &&
00698                         (face_order[i] != 'E') &&
00699                         (face_order[i] != 'U') &&
00700                         (face_order[i] != 'D') )
00701                 {
00702                         result_string_pointer = "Invalid single cube map face order";
00703                         return 0;
00704                 };
00705         }
00706         /*      capability checking     */
00707         if( query_cubemap_capability() != SOIL_CAPABILITY_PRESENT )
00708         {
00709                 result_string_pointer = "No cube map capability present";
00710                 return 0;
00711         }
00712         /*      1st off, try to load the full image     */
00713         img = SOIL_load_image( filename, &width, &height, &channels, force_channels );
00714         /*      channels holds the original number of channels, which may have been forced      */
00715         if( (force_channels >= 1) && (force_channels <= 4) )
00716         {
00717                 channels = force_channels;
00718         }
00719         if( NULL == img )
00720         {
00721                 /*      image loading failed    */
00722                 result_string_pointer = stbi_failure_reason();
00723                 return 0;
00724         }
00725         /*      now, does this image have the right dimensions? */
00726         if( (width != 6*height) &&
00727                 (6*width != height) )
00728         {
00729                 SOIL_free_image_data( img );
00730                 result_string_pointer = "Single cubemap image must have a 6:1 ratio";
00731                 return 0;
00732         }
00733         /*      try the image split and create  */
00734         tex_id = SOIL_create_OGL_single_cubemap(
00735                         img, width, height, channels,
00736                         face_order, reuse_texture_ID, flags
00737                         );
00738         /*      nuke the temporary image data and return the texture handle     */
00739         SOIL_free_image_data( img );
00740         return tex_id;
00741 }
00742 
00743 unsigned int
00744         SOIL_load_OGL_single_cubemap_from_memory
00745         (
00746                 const unsigned char *const buffer,
00747                 int buffer_length,
00748                 const char face_order[6],
00749                 int force_channels,
00750                 unsigned int reuse_texture_ID,
00751                 unsigned int flags
00752         )
00753 {
00754         /*      variables       */
00755         unsigned char* img;
00756         int width, height, channels, i;
00757         unsigned int tex_id = 0;
00758         /*      error checking  */
00759         if( buffer == NULL )
00760         {
00761                 result_string_pointer = "Invalid single cube map buffer";
00762                 return 0;
00763         }
00764         /*      does the user want direct uploading of the image as a DDS file? */
00765         if( flags & SOIL_FLAG_DDS_LOAD_DIRECT )
00766         {
00767                 /*      1st try direct loading of the image as a DDS file
00768                         note: direct uploading will only load what is in the
00769                         DDS file, no MIPmaps will be generated, the image will
00770                         not be flipped, etc.    */
00771                 tex_id = SOIL_direct_load_DDS_from_memory(
00772                                 buffer, buffer_length,
00773                                 reuse_texture_ID, flags, 1 );
00774                 if( tex_id )
00775                 {
00776                         /*      hey, it worked!!        */
00777                         return tex_id;
00778                 }
00779         }
00780         /*      face order checking     */
00781         for( i = 0; i < 6; ++i )
00782         {
00783                 if( (face_order[i] != 'N') &&
00784                         (face_order[i] != 'S') &&
00785                         (face_order[i] != 'W') &&
00786                         (face_order[i] != 'E') &&
00787                         (face_order[i] != 'U') &&
00788                         (face_order[i] != 'D') )
00789                 {
00790                         result_string_pointer = "Invalid single cube map face order";
00791                         return 0;
00792                 };
00793         }
00794         /*      capability checking     */
00795         if( query_cubemap_capability() != SOIL_CAPABILITY_PRESENT )
00796         {
00797                 result_string_pointer = "No cube map capability present";
00798                 return 0;
00799         }
00800         /*      1st off, try to load the full image     */
00801         img = SOIL_load_image_from_memory(
00802                         buffer, buffer_length,
00803                         &width, &height, &channels,
00804                         force_channels );
00805         /*      channels holds the original number of channels, which may have been forced      */
00806         if( (force_channels >= 1) && (force_channels <= 4) )
00807         {
00808                 channels = force_channels;
00809         }
00810         if( NULL == img )
00811         {
00812                 /*      image loading failed    */
00813                 result_string_pointer = stbi_failure_reason();
00814                 return 0;
00815         }
00816         /*      now, does this image have the right dimensions? */
00817         if( (width != 6*height) &&
00818                 (6*width != height) )
00819         {
00820                 SOIL_free_image_data( img );
00821                 result_string_pointer = "Single cubemap image must have a 6:1 ratio";
00822                 return 0;
00823         }
00824         /*      try the image split and create  */
00825         tex_id = SOIL_create_OGL_single_cubemap(
00826                         img, width, height, channels,
00827                         face_order, reuse_texture_ID, flags
00828                         );
00829         /*      nuke the temporary image data and return the texture handle     */
00830         SOIL_free_image_data( img );
00831         return tex_id;
00832 }
00833 
00834 unsigned int
00835         SOIL_create_OGL_single_cubemap
00836         (
00837                 const unsigned char *const data,
00838                 int width, int height, int channels,
00839                 const char face_order[6],
00840                 unsigned int reuse_texture_ID,
00841                 unsigned int flags
00842         )
00843 {
00844         /*      variables       */
00845         unsigned char* sub_img;
00846         int dw, dh, sz, i;
00847         unsigned int tex_id;
00848         /*      error checking  */
00849         if( data == NULL )
00850         {
00851                 result_string_pointer = "Invalid single cube map image data";
00852                 return 0;
00853         }
00854         /*      face order checking     */
00855         for( i = 0; i < 6; ++i )
00856         {
00857                 if( (face_order[i] != 'N') &&
00858                         (face_order[i] != 'S') &&
00859                         (face_order[i] != 'W') &&
00860                         (face_order[i] != 'E') &&
00861                         (face_order[i] != 'U') &&
00862                         (face_order[i] != 'D') )
00863                 {
00864                         result_string_pointer = "Invalid single cube map face order";
00865                         return 0;
00866                 };
00867         }
00868         /*      capability checking     */
00869         if( query_cubemap_capability() != SOIL_CAPABILITY_PRESENT )
00870         {
00871                 result_string_pointer = "No cube map capability present";
00872                 return 0;
00873         }
00874         /*      now, does this image have the right dimensions? */
00875         if( (width != 6*height) &&
00876                 (6*width != height) )
00877         {
00878                 result_string_pointer = "Single cubemap image must have a 6:1 ratio";
00879                 return 0;
00880         }
00881         /*      which way am I stepping?        */
00882         if( width > height )
00883         {
00884                 dw = height;
00885                 dh = 0;
00886         } else
00887         {
00888                 dw = 0;
00889                 dh = width;
00890         }
00891         sz = dw+dh;
00892         sub_img = (unsigned char *)malloc( sz*sz*channels );
00893         /*      do the splitting and uploading  */
00894         tex_id = reuse_texture_ID;
00895         for( i = 0; i < 6; ++i )
00896         {
00897                 int x, y, idx = 0;
00898                 unsigned int cubemap_target = 0;
00899                 /*      copy in the sub-image   */
00900                 for( y = i*dh; y < i*dh+sz; ++y )
00901                 {
00902                         for( x = i*dw*channels; x < (i*dw+sz)*channels; ++x )
00903                         {
00904                                 sub_img[idx++] = data[y*width*channels+x];
00905                         }
00906                 }
00907                 /*      what is my texture target?
00908                         remember, this coordinate system is
00909                         LHS if viewed from inside the cube!     */
00910                 switch( face_order[i] )
00911                 {
00912                 case 'N':
00913                         cubemap_target = SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z;
00914                         break;
00915                 case 'S':
00916                         cubemap_target = SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z;
00917                         break;
00918                 case 'W':
00919                         cubemap_target = SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X;
00920                         break;
00921                 case 'E':
00922                         cubemap_target = SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X;
00923                         break;
00924                 case 'U':
00925                         cubemap_target = SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y;
00926                         break;
00927                 case 'D':
00928                         cubemap_target = SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y;
00929                         break;
00930                 }
00931                 /*      upload it as a texture  */
00932                 tex_id = SOIL_internal_create_OGL_texture(
00933                                 sub_img, sz, sz, channels,
00934                                 tex_id, flags,
00935                                 SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP,
00936                                 cubemap_target,
00937                                 SOIL_MAX_CUBE_MAP_TEXTURE_SIZE );
00938         }
00939         /*      and nuke the image and sub-image data   */
00940         SOIL_free_image_data( sub_img );
00941         /*      and return the handle, such as it is    */
00942         return tex_id;
00943 }
00944 
00945 unsigned int
00946         SOIL_create_OGL_texture
00947         (
00948                 const unsigned char *const data,
00949                 int width, int height, int channels,
00950                 unsigned int reuse_texture_ID,
00951                 unsigned int flags
00952         )
00953 {
00954         /*      wrapper function for 2D textures        */
00955         return SOIL_internal_create_OGL_texture(
00956                                 data, width, height, channels,
00957                                 reuse_texture_ID, flags,
00958                                 GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_2D,
00959                                 GL_MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE );
00960 }
00961 
00962 #if SOIL_CHECK_FOR_GL_ERRORS
00963 void check_for_GL_errors( const char *calling_location )
00964 {
00965         /*      check for errors        */
00966         GLenum err_code = glGetError();
00967         while( GL_NO_ERROR != err_code )
00968         {
00969                 printf( "OpenGL Error @ %s: %i", calling_location, err_code );
00970                 err_code = glGetError();
00971         }
00972 }
00973 #else
00974 void check_for_GL_errors( const char *calling_location )
00975 {
00976         /*      no check for errors     */
00977 }
00978 #endif
00979 
00980 unsigned int
00981         SOIL_internal_create_OGL_texture
00982         (
00983                 const unsigned char *const data,
00984                 int width, int height, int channels,
00985                 unsigned int reuse_texture_ID,
00986                 unsigned int flags,
00987                 unsigned int opengl_texture_type,
00988                 unsigned int opengl_texture_target,
00989                 unsigned int texture_check_size_enum
00990         )
00991 {
00992         /*      variables       */
00993         unsigned char* img;
00994         unsigned int tex_id;
00995         unsigned int internal_texture_format = 0, original_texture_format = 0;
00996         int DXT_mode = SOIL_CAPABILITY_UNKNOWN;
00997         int max_supported_size;
00998         /*      If the user wants to use the texture rectangle I kill a few flags       */
00999         if( flags & SOIL_FLAG_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE )
01000         {
01001                 /*      well, the user asked for it, can we do that?    */
01002                 if( query_tex_rectangle_capability() == SOIL_CAPABILITY_PRESENT )
01003                 {
01004                         /*      only allow this if the user in _NOT_ trying to do a cubemap!    */
01005                         if( opengl_texture_type == GL_TEXTURE_2D )
01006                         {
01007                                 /*      clean out the flags that cannot be used with texture rectangles */
01008                                 flags &= ~(
01009                                                 SOIL_FLAG_POWER_OF_TWO | SOIL_FLAG_MIPMAPS |
01010                                                 SOIL_FLAG_TEXTURE_REPEATS
01011                                         );
01012                                 /*      and change my target    */
01013                                 opengl_texture_target = SOIL_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE_ARB;
01014                                 opengl_texture_type = SOIL_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE_ARB;
01015                         } else
01016                         {
01017                                 /*      not allowed for any other uses (yes, I'm looking at you, cubemaps!)     */
01018                                 flags &= ~SOIL_FLAG_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE;
01019                         }
01020 
01021                 } else
01022                 {
01023                         /*      can't do it, and that is a breakable offense (uv coords use pixels instead of [0,1]!)   */
01024                         result_string_pointer = "Texture Rectangle extension unsupported";
01025                         return 0;
01026                 }
01027         }
01028         /*      create a copy the image data    */
01029         img = (unsigned char*)malloc( width*height*channels );
01030         memcpy( img, data, width*height*channels );
01031         /*      does the user want me to invert the image?      */
01032         if( flags & SOIL_FLAG_INVERT_Y )
01033         {
01034                 int i, j;
01035                 for( j = 0; j*2 < height; ++j )
01036                 {
01037                         int index1 = j * width * channels;
01038                         int index2 = (height - 1 - j) * width * channels;
01039                         for( i = width * channels; i > 0; --i )
01040                         {
01041                                 unsigned char temp = img[index1];
01042                                 img[index1] = img[index2];
01043                                 img[index2] = temp;
01044                                 ++index1;
01045                                 ++index2;
01046                         }
01047                 }
01048         }
01049         /*      does the user want me to scale the colors into the NTSC safe RGB range? */
01050         if( flags & SOIL_FLAG_NTSC_SAFE_RGB )
01051         {
01052                 scale_image_RGB_to_NTSC_safe( img, width, height, channels );
01053         }
01054         /*      does the user want me to convert from straight to pre-multiplied alpha?
01055                 (and do we even _have_ alpha?)  */
01056         if( flags & SOIL_FLAG_MULTIPLY_ALPHA )
01057         {
01058                 int i;
01059                 switch( channels )
01060                 {
01061                 case 2:
01062                         for( i = 0; i < 2*width*height; i += 2 )
01063                         {
01064                                 img[i] = (img[i] * img[i+1] + 128) >> 8;
01065                         }
01066                         break;
01067                 case 4:
01068                         for( i = 0; i < 4*width*height; i += 4 )
01069                         {
01070                                 img[i+0] = (img[i+0] * img[i+3] + 128) >> 8;
01071                                 img[i+1] = (img[i+1] * img[i+3] + 128) >> 8;
01072                                 img[i+2] = (img[i+2] * img[i+3] + 128) >> 8;
01073                         }
01074                         break;
01075                 default:
01076                         /*      no other number of channels contains alpha data */
01077                         break;
01078                 }
01079         }
01080         /*      if the user can't support NPOT textures, make sure we force the POT option      */
01081         if( (query_NPOT_capability() == SOIL_CAPABILITY_NONE) &&
01082                 !(flags & SOIL_FLAG_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE) )
01083         {
01084                 /*      add in the POT flag */
01085                 flags |= SOIL_FLAG_POWER_OF_TWO;
01086         }
01087         /*      how large of a texture can this OpenGL implementation handle?   */
01088         /*      texture_check_size_enum will be GL_MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE or SOIL_MAX_CUBE_MAP_TEXTURE_SIZE   */
01089         glGetIntegerv( texture_check_size_enum, &max_supported_size );
01090         /*      do I need to make it a power of 2?      */
01091         if(
01092                 (flags & SOIL_FLAG_POWER_OF_TWO) ||     /*      user asked for it       */
01093                 (flags & SOIL_FLAG_MIPMAPS) ||          /*      need it for the MIP-maps        */
01094                 (width > max_supported_size) ||         /*      it's too big, (make sure it's   */
01095                 (height > max_supported_size) )         /*      2^n for later down-sampling)    */
01096         {
01097                 int new_width = 1;
01098                 int new_height = 1;
01099                 while( new_width < width )
01100                 {
01101                         new_width *= 2;
01102                 }
01103                 while( new_height < height )
01104                 {
01105                         new_height *= 2;
01106                 }
01107                 /*      still?  */
01108                 if( (new_width != width) || (new_height != height) )
01109                 {
01110                         /*      yep, resize     */
01111                         unsigned char *resampled = (unsigned char*)malloc( channels*new_width*new_height );
01112                         up_scale_image(
01113                                         img, width, height, channels,
01114                                         resampled, new_width, new_height );
01115                         /*      OJO     this is for debug only! */
01116                         /*
01117                         SOIL_save_image( "\\showme.bmp", SOIL_SAVE_TYPE_BMP,
01118                                                         new_width, new_height, channels,
01119                                                         resampled );
01120                         */
01121                         /*      nuke the old guy, then point it at the new guy  */
01122                         SOIL_free_image_data( img );
01123                         img = resampled;
01124                         width = new_width;
01125                         height = new_height;
01126                 }
01127         }
01128         /*      now, if it is too large...      */
01129         if( (width > max_supported_size) || (height > max_supported_size) )
01130         {
01131                 /*      I've already made it a power of two, so simply use the MIPmapping
01132                         code to reduce its size to the allowable maximum.       */
01133                 unsigned char *resampled;
01134                 int reduce_block_x = 1, reduce_block_y = 1;
01135                 int new_width, new_height;
01136                 if( width > max_supported_size )
01137                 {
01138                         reduce_block_x = width / max_supported_size;
01139                 }
01140                 if( height > max_supported_size )
01141                 {
01142                         reduce_block_y = height / max_supported_size;
01143                 }
01144                 new_width = width / reduce_block_x;
01145                 new_height = height / reduce_block_y;
01146                 resampled = (unsigned char*)malloc( channels*new_width*new_height );
01147                 /*      perform the actual reduction    */
01148                 mipmap_image(   img, width, height, channels,
01149                                                 resampled, reduce_block_x, reduce_block_y );
01150                 /*      nuke the old guy, then point it at the new guy  */
01151                 SOIL_free_image_data( img );
01152                 img = resampled;
01153                 width = new_width;
01154                 height = new_height;
01155         }
01156         /*      does the user want us to use YCoCg color space? */
01157         if( flags & SOIL_FLAG_CoCg_Y )
01158         {
01159                 /*      this will only work with RGB and RGBA images */
01160                 convert_RGB_to_YCoCg( img, width, height, channels );
01161                 /*
01162                 save_image_as_DDS( "CoCg_Y.dds", width, height, channels, img );
01163                 */
01164         }
01165         /*      create the OpenGL texture ID handle
01166         (note: allowing a forced texture ID lets me reload a texture)   */
01167     tex_id = reuse_texture_ID;
01168     if( tex_id == 0 )
01169     {
01170                 glGenTextures( 1, &tex_id );
01171     }
01172         check_for_GL_errors( "glGenTextures" );
01173         /* Note: sometimes glGenTextures fails (usually no OpenGL context)      */
01174         if( tex_id )
01175         {
01176                 /*      and what type am I using as the internal texture format?        */
01177                 switch( channels )
01178                 {
01179                 case 1:
01180                         original_texture_format = GL_LUMINANCE;
01181                         break;
01182                 case 2:
01183                         original_texture_format = GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA;
01184                         break;
01185                 case 3:
01186                         original_texture_format = GL_RGB;
01187                         break;
01188                 case 4:
01189                         original_texture_format = GL_RGBA;
01190                         break;
01191                 }
01192                 internal_texture_format = original_texture_format;
01193                 /*      does the user want me to, and can I, save as DXT?       */
01194                 if( flags & SOIL_FLAG_COMPRESS_TO_DXT )
01195                 {
01196                         DXT_mode = query_DXT_capability();
01197                         if( DXT_mode == SOIL_CAPABILITY_PRESENT )
01198                         {
01199                                 /*      I can use DXT, whether I compress it or OpenGL does     */
01200                                 if( (channels & 1) == 1 )
01201                                 {
01202                                         /*      1 or 3 channels = DXT1  */
01203                                         internal_texture_format = SOIL_RGB_S3TC_DXT1;
01204                                 } else
01205                                 {
01206                                         /*      2 or 4 channels = DXT5  */
01207                                         internal_texture_format = SOIL_RGBA_S3TC_DXT5;
01208                                 }
01209                         }
01210                 }
01211                 /*  bind an OpenGL texture ID   */
01212                 glBindTexture( opengl_texture_type, tex_id );
01213                 check_for_GL_errors( "glBindTexture" );
01214                 /*  upload the main image       */
01215                 if( DXT_mode == SOIL_CAPABILITY_PRESENT )
01216                 {
01217                         /*      user wants me to do the DXT conversion! */
01218                         int DDS_size;
01219                         unsigned char *DDS_data = NULL;
01220                         if( (channels & 1) == 1 )
01221                         {
01222                                 /*      RGB, use DXT1   */
01223                                 DDS_data = convert_image_to_DXT1( img, width, height, channels, &DDS_size );
01224                         } else
01225                         {
01226                                 /*      RGBA, use DXT5  */
01227                                 DDS_data = convert_image_to_DXT5( img, width, height, channels, &DDS_size );
01228                         }
01229                         if( DDS_data )
01230                         {
01231                                 soilGlCompressedTexImage2D(
01232                                         opengl_texture_target, 0,
01233                                         internal_texture_format, width, height, 0,
01234                                         DDS_size, DDS_data );
01235                                 check_for_GL_errors( "glCompressedTexImage2D" );
01236                                 SOIL_free_image_data( DDS_data );
01237                                 /*      printf( "Internal DXT compressor\n" );  */
01238                         } else
01239                         {
01240                                 /*      my compression failed, try the OpenGL driver's version  */
01241                                 glTexImage2D(
01242                                         opengl_texture_target, 0,
01243                                         internal_texture_format, width, height, 0,
01244                                         original_texture_format, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, img );
01245                                 check_for_GL_errors( "glTexImage2D" );
01246                                 /*      printf( "OpenGL DXT compressor\n" );    */
01247                         }
01248                 } else
01249                 {
01250                         /*      user want OpenGL to do all the work!    */
01251                         glTexImage2D(
01252                                 opengl_texture_target, 0,
01253                                 internal_texture_format, width, height, 0,
01254                                 original_texture_format, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, img );
01255                         check_for_GL_errors( "glTexImage2D" );
01256                         /*printf( "OpenGL DXT compressor\n" );  */
01257                 }
01258                 /*      are any MIPmaps desired?        */
01259                 if( flags & SOIL_FLAG_MIPMAPS )
01260                 {
01261                         int MIPlevel = 1;
01262                         int MIPwidth = (width+1) / 2;
01263                         int MIPheight = (height+1) / 2;
01264                         unsigned char *resampled = (unsigned char*)malloc( channels*MIPwidth*MIPheight );
01265                         while( ((1<<MIPlevel) <= width) || ((1<<MIPlevel) <= height) )
01266                         {
01267                                 /*      do this MIPmap level    */
01268                                 mipmap_image(
01269                                                 img, width, height, channels,
01270                                                 resampled,
01271                                                 (1 << MIPlevel), (1 << MIPlevel) );
01272                                 /*  upload the MIPmaps  */
01273                                 if( DXT_mode == SOIL_CAPABILITY_PRESENT )
01274                                 {
01275                                         /*      user wants me to do the DXT conversion! */
01276                                         int DDS_size;
01277                                         unsigned char *DDS_data = NULL;
01278                                         if( (channels & 1) == 1 )
01279                                         {
01280                                                 /*      RGB, use DXT1   */
01281                                                 DDS_data = convert_image_to_DXT1(
01282                                                                 resampled, MIPwidth, MIPheight, channels, &DDS_size );
01283                                         } else
01284                                         {
01285                                                 /*      RGBA, use DXT5  */
01286                                                 DDS_data = convert_image_to_DXT5(
01287                                                                 resampled, MIPwidth, MIPheight, channels, &DDS_size );
01288                                         }
01289                                         if( DDS_data )
01290                                         {
01291                                                 soilGlCompressedTexImage2D(
01292                                                         opengl_texture_target, MIPlevel,
01293                                                         internal_texture_format, MIPwidth, MIPheight, 0,
01294                                                         DDS_size, DDS_data );
01295                                                 check_for_GL_errors( "glCompressedTexImage2D" );
01296                                                 SOIL_free_image_data( DDS_data );
01297                                         } else
01298                                         {
01299                                                 /*      my compression failed, try the OpenGL driver's version  */
01300                                                 glTexImage2D(
01301                                                         opengl_texture_target, MIPlevel,
01302                                                         internal_texture_format, MIPwidth, MIPheight, 0,
01303                                                         original_texture_format, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, resampled );
01304                                                 check_for_GL_errors( "glTexImage2D" );
01305                                         }
01306                                 } else
01307                                 {
01308                                         /*      user want OpenGL to do all the work!    */
01309                                         glTexImage2D(
01310                                                 opengl_texture_target, MIPlevel,
01311                                                 internal_texture_format, MIPwidth, MIPheight, 0,
01312                                                 original_texture_format, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, resampled );
01313                                         check_for_GL_errors( "glTexImage2D" );
01314                                 }
01315                                 /*      prep for the next level */
01316                                 ++MIPlevel;
01317                                 MIPwidth = (MIPwidth + 1) / 2;
01318                                 MIPheight = (MIPheight + 1) / 2;
01319                         }
01320                         SOIL_free_image_data( resampled );
01321                         /*      instruct OpenGL to use the MIPmaps      */
01322                         glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, GL_TEXTURE_MAG_FILTER, GL_LINEAR );
01323                         glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, GL_TEXTURE_MIN_FILTER, GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR );
01324                         check_for_GL_errors( "GL_TEXTURE_MIN/MAG_FILTER" );
01325                 } else
01326                 {
01327                         /*      instruct OpenGL _NOT_ to use the MIPmaps        */
01328                         glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, GL_TEXTURE_MAG_FILTER, GL_LINEAR );
01329                         glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, GL_TEXTURE_MIN_FILTER, GL_LINEAR );
01330                         check_for_GL_errors( "GL_TEXTURE_MIN/MAG_FILTER" );
01331                 }
01332                 /*      does the user want clamping, or wrapping?       */
01333                 if( flags & SOIL_FLAG_TEXTURE_REPEATS )
01334                 {
01335                         glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_S, GL_REPEAT );
01336                         glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_T, GL_REPEAT );
01337                         if( opengl_texture_type == SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP )
01338                         {
01339                                 /*      SOIL_TEXTURE_WRAP_R is invalid if cubemaps aren't supported     */
01340                                 glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, SOIL_TEXTURE_WRAP_R, GL_REPEAT );
01341                         }
01342                         check_for_GL_errors( "GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_*" );
01343                 } else
01344                 {
01345                         /*      unsigned int clamp_mode = SOIL_CLAMP_TO_EDGE;   */
01346                         unsigned int clamp_mode = GL_CLAMP;
01347                         glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_S, clamp_mode );
01348                         glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_T, clamp_mode );
01349                         if( opengl_texture_type == SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP )
01350                         {
01351                                 /*      SOIL_TEXTURE_WRAP_R is invalid if cubemaps aren't supported     */
01352                                 glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, SOIL_TEXTURE_WRAP_R, clamp_mode );
01353                         }
01354                         check_for_GL_errors( "GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_*" );
01355                 }
01356                 /*      done    */
01357                 result_string_pointer = "Image loaded as an OpenGL texture";
01358         } else
01359         {
01360                 /*      failed  */
01361                 result_string_pointer = "Failed to generate an OpenGL texture name; missing OpenGL context?";
01362         }
01363         SOIL_free_image_data( img );
01364         return tex_id;
01365 }
01366 
01367 int
01368         SOIL_save_screenshot
01369         (
01370                 const char *filename,
01371                 int image_type,
01372                 int x, int y,
01373                 int width, int height
01374         )
01375 {
01376         unsigned char *pixel_data;
01377         int i, j;
01378         int save_result;
01379 
01380         /*      error checks    */
01381         if( (width < 1) || (height < 1) )
01382         {
01383                 result_string_pointer = "Invalid screenshot dimensions";
01384                 return 0;
01385         }
01386         if( (x < 0) || (y < 0) )
01387         {
01388                 result_string_pointer = "Invalid screenshot location";
01389                 return 0;
01390         }
01391         if( filename == NULL )
01392         {
01393                 result_string_pointer = "Invalid screenshot filename";
01394                 return 0;
01395         }
01396 
01397     /*  Get the data from OpenGL        */
01398     pixel_data = (unsigned char*)malloc( 3*width*height );
01399     glReadPixels (x, y, width, height, GL_RGB, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, pixel_data);
01400 
01401     /*  invert the image        */
01402     for( j = 0; j*2 < height; ++j )
01403         {
01404                 int index1 = j * width * 3;
01405                 int index2 = (height - 1 - j) * width * 3;
01406                 for( i = width * 3; i > 0; --i )
01407                 {
01408                         unsigned char temp = pixel_data[index1];
01409                         pixel_data[index1] = pixel_data[index2];
01410                         pixel_data[index2] = temp;
01411                         ++index1;
01412                         ++index2;
01413                 }
01414         }
01415 
01416     /*  save the image  */
01417     save_result = SOIL_save_image( filename, image_type, width, height, 3, pixel_data);
01418 
01419     /*  And free the memory     */
01420     SOIL_free_image_data( pixel_data );
01421         return save_result;
01422 }
01423 
01424 unsigned char*
01425         SOIL_load_image
01426         (
01427                 const char *filename,
01428                 int *width, int *height, int *channels,
01429                 int force_channels
01430         )
01431 {
01432         unsigned char *result = stbi_load( filename,
01433                         width, height, channels, force_channels );
01434         if( result == NULL )
01435         {
01436                 result_string_pointer = stbi_failure_reason();
01437         } else
01438         {
01439                 result_string_pointer = "Image loaded";
01440         }
01441         return result;
01442 }
01443 
01444 unsigned char*
01445         SOIL_load_image_from_memory
01446         (
01447                 const unsigned char *const buffer,
01448                 int buffer_length,
01449                 int *width, int *height, int *channels,
01450                 int force_channels
01451         )
01452 {
01453         unsigned char *result = stbi_load_from_memory(
01454                                 buffer, buffer_length,
01455                                 width, height, channels,
01456                                 force_channels );
01457         if( result == NULL )
01458         {
01459                 result_string_pointer = stbi_failure_reason();
01460         } else
01461         {
01462                 result_string_pointer = "Image loaded from memory";
01463         }
01464         return result;
01465 }
01466 
01467 int
01468         SOIL_save_image
01469         (
01470                 const char *filename,
01471                 int image_type,
01472                 int width, int height, int channels,
01473                 const unsigned char *const data
01474         )
01475 {
01476         int save_result;
01477 
01478         /*      error check     */
01479         if( (width < 1) || (height < 1) ||
01480                 (channels < 1) || (channels > 4) ||
01481                 (data == NULL) ||
01482                 (filename == NULL) )
01483         {
01484                 return 0;
01485         }
01486         if( image_type == SOIL_SAVE_TYPE_BMP )
01487         {
01488                 save_result = stbi_write_bmp( filename,
01489                                 width, height, channels, (void*)data );
01490         } else
01491         if( image_type == SOIL_SAVE_TYPE_TGA )
01492         {
01493                 save_result = stbi_write_tga( filename,
01494                                 width, height, channels, (void*)data );
01495         } else
01496         if( image_type == SOIL_SAVE_TYPE_DDS )
01497         {
01498                 save_result = save_image_as_DDS( filename,
01499                                 width, height, channels, (const unsigned char *const)data );
01500         } else
01501         {
01502                 save_result = 0;
01503         }
01504         if( save_result == 0 )
01505         {
01506                 result_string_pointer = "Saving the image failed";
01507         } else
01508         {
01509                 result_string_pointer = "Image saved";
01510         }
01511         return save_result;
01512 }
01513 
01514 void
01515         SOIL_free_image_data
01516         (
01517                 unsigned char *img_data
01518         )
01519 {
01520         free( (void*)img_data );
01521 }
01522 
01523 const char*
01524         SOIL_last_result
01525         (
01526                 void
01527         )
01528 {
01529         return result_string_pointer;
01530 }
01531 
01532 unsigned int SOIL_direct_load_DDS_from_memory(
01533                 const unsigned char *const buffer,
01534                 int buffer_length,
01535                 unsigned int reuse_texture_ID,
01536                 int flags,
01537                 int loading_as_cubemap )
01538 {
01539         /*      variables       */
01540         DDS_header header;
01541         unsigned int buffer_index = 0;
01542         unsigned int tex_ID = 0;
01543         /*      file reading variables  */
01544         unsigned int S3TC_type = 0;
01545         unsigned char *DDS_data;
01546         unsigned int DDS_main_size;
01547         unsigned int DDS_full_size;
01548         unsigned int width, height;
01549         int mipmaps, cubemap, uncompressed, block_size = 16;
01550         unsigned int flag;
01551         unsigned int cf_target, ogl_target_start, ogl_target_end;
01552         unsigned int opengl_texture_type;
01553         int i;
01554         /*      1st off, does the filename even exist?  */
01555         if( NULL == buffer )
01556         {
01557                 /*      we can't do it! */
01558                 result_string_pointer = "NULL buffer";
01559                 return 0;
01560         }
01561         if( buffer_length < sizeof( DDS_header ) )
01562         {
01563                 /*      we can't do it! */
01564                 result_string_pointer = "DDS file was too small to contain the DDS header";
01565                 return 0;
01566         }
01567         /*      try reading in the header       */
01568         memcpy ( (void*)(&header), (const void *)buffer, sizeof( DDS_header ) );
01569         buffer_index = sizeof( DDS_header );
01570         /*      guilty until proven innocent    */
01571         result_string_pointer = "Failed to read a known DDS header";
01572         /*      validate the header (warning, "goto"'s ahead, shield your eyes!!)       */
01573         flag = ('D'<<0)|('D'<<8)|('S'<<16)|(' '<<24);
01574         if( header.dwMagic != flag ) {goto quick_exit;}
01575         if( header.dwSize != 124 ) {goto quick_exit;}
01576         /*      I need all of these     */
01577         flag = DDSD_CAPS | DDSD_HEIGHT | DDSD_WIDTH | DDSD_PIXELFORMAT;
01578         if( (header.dwFlags & flag) != flag ) {goto quick_exit;}
01579         /*      According to the MSDN spec, the dwFlags should contain
01580                 DDSD_LINEARSIZE if it's compressed, or DDSD_PITCH if
01581                 uncompressed.  Some DDS writers do not conform to the
01582                 spec, so I need to make my reader more tolerant */
01583         /*      I need one of these     */
01584         flag = DDPF_FOURCC | DDPF_RGB;
01585         if( (header.sPixelFormat.dwFlags & flag) == 0 ) {goto quick_exit;}
01586         if( header.sPixelFormat.dwSize != 32 ) {goto quick_exit;}
01587         if( (header.sCaps.dwCaps1 & DDSCAPS_TEXTURE) == 0 ) {goto quick_exit;}
01588         /*      make sure it is a type we can upload    */
01589         if( (header.sPixelFormat.dwFlags & DDPF_FOURCC) &&
01590                 !(
01591                 (header.sPixelFormat.dwFourCC == (('D'<<0)|('X'<<8)|('T'<<16)|('1'<<24))) ||
01592                 (header.sPixelFormat.dwFourCC == (('D'<<0)|('X'<<8)|('T'<<16)|('3'<<24))) ||
01593                 (header.sPixelFormat.dwFourCC == (('D'<<0)|('X'<<8)|('T'<<16)|('5'<<24)))
01594                 ) )
01595         {
01596                 goto quick_exit;
01597         }
01598         /*      OK, validated the header, let's load the image data     */
01599         result_string_pointer = "DDS header loaded and validated";
01600         width = header.dwWidth;
01601         height = header.dwHeight;
01602         uncompressed = 1 - (header.sPixelFormat.dwFlags & DDPF_FOURCC) / DDPF_FOURCC;
01603         cubemap = (header.sCaps.dwCaps2 & DDSCAPS2_CUBEMAP) / DDSCAPS2_CUBEMAP;
01604         if( uncompressed )
01605         {
01606                 S3TC_type = GL_RGB;
01607                 block_size = 3;
01608                 if( header.sPixelFormat.dwFlags & DDPF_ALPHAPIXELS )
01609                 {
01610                         S3TC_type = GL_RGBA;
01611                         block_size = 4;
01612                 }
01613                 DDS_main_size = width * height * block_size;
01614         } else
01615         {
01616                 /*      can we even handle direct uploading to OpenGL DXT compressed images?    */
01617                 if( query_DXT_capability() != SOIL_CAPABILITY_PRESENT )
01618                 {
01619                         /*      we can't do it! */
01620                         result_string_pointer = "Direct upload of S3TC images not supported by the OpenGL driver";
01621                         return 0;
01622                 }
01623                 /*      well, we know it is DXT1/3/5, because we checked above  */
01624                 switch( (header.sPixelFormat.dwFourCC >> 24) - '0' )
01625                 {
01626                 case 1:
01627                         S3TC_type = SOIL_RGBA_S3TC_DXT1;
01628                         block_size = 8;
01629                         break;
01630                 case 3:
01631                         S3TC_type = SOIL_RGBA_S3TC_DXT3;
01632                         block_size = 16;
01633                         break;
01634                 case 5:
01635                         S3TC_type = SOIL_RGBA_S3TC_DXT5;
01636                         block_size = 16;
01637                         break;
01638                 }
01639                 DDS_main_size = ((width+3)>>2)*((height+3)>>2)*block_size;
01640         }
01641         if( cubemap )
01642         {
01643                 /* does the user want a cubemap?        */
01644                 if( !loading_as_cubemap )
01645                 {
01646                         /*      we can't do it! */
01647                         result_string_pointer = "DDS image was a cubemap";
01648                         return 0;
01649                 }
01650                 /*      can we even handle cubemaps with the OpenGL driver?     */
01651                 if( query_cubemap_capability() != SOIL_CAPABILITY_PRESENT )
01652                 {
01653                         /*      we can't do it! */
01654                         result_string_pointer = "Direct upload of cubemap images not supported by the OpenGL driver";
01655                         return 0;
01656                 }
01657                 ogl_target_start = SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X;
01658                 ogl_target_end =   SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z;
01659                 opengl_texture_type = SOIL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP;
01660         } else
01661         {
01662                 /* does the user want a non-cubemap?    */
01663                 if( loading_as_cubemap )
01664                 {
01665                         /*      we can't do it! */
01666                         result_string_pointer = "DDS image was not a cubemap";
01667                         return 0;
01668                 }
01669                 ogl_target_start = GL_TEXTURE_2D;
01670                 ogl_target_end =   GL_TEXTURE_2D;
01671                 opengl_texture_type = GL_TEXTURE_2D;
01672         }
01673         if( (header.sCaps.dwCaps1 & DDSCAPS_MIPMAP) && (header.dwMipMapCount > 1) )
01674         {
01675                 int shift_offset;
01676                 mipmaps = header.dwMipMapCount - 1;
01677                 DDS_full_size = DDS_main_size;
01678                 if( uncompressed )
01679                 {
01680                         /*      uncompressed DDS, simple MIPmap size calculation        */
01681                         shift_offset = 0;
01682                 } else
01683                 {
01684                         /*      compressed DDS, MIPmap size calculation is block based  */
01685                         shift_offset = 2;
01686                 }
01687                 for( i = 1; i <= mipmaps; ++ i )
01688                 {
01689                         int w, h;
01690                         w = width >> (shift_offset + i);
01691                         h = height >> (shift_offset + i);
01692                         if( w < 1 )
01693                         {
01694                                 w = 1;
01695                         }
01696                         if( h < 1 )
01697                         {
01698                                 h = 1;
01699                         }
01700                         DDS_full_size += w*h*block_size;
01701                 }
01702         } else
01703         {
01704                 mipmaps = 0;
01705                 DDS_full_size = DDS_main_size;
01706         }
01707         DDS_data = (unsigned char*)malloc( DDS_full_size );
01708         /*      got the image data RAM, create or use an existing OpenGL texture handle */
01709         tex_ID = reuse_texture_ID;
01710         if( tex_ID == 0 )
01711         {
01712                 glGenTextures( 1, &tex_ID );
01713         }
01714         /*  bind an OpenGL texture ID   */
01715         glBindTexture( opengl_texture_type, tex_ID );
01716         /*      do this for each face of the cubemap!   */
01717         for( cf_target = ogl_target_start; cf_target <= ogl_target_end; ++cf_target )
01718         {
01719                 if( buffer_index + DDS_full_size <= buffer_length )
01720                 {
01721                         unsigned int byte_offset = DDS_main_size;
01722                         memcpy( (void*)DDS_data, (const void*)(&buffer[buffer_index]), DDS_full_size );
01723                         buffer_index += DDS_full_size;
01724                         /*      upload the main chunk   */
01725                         if( uncompressed )
01726                         {
01727                                 /*      and remember, DXT uncompressed uses BGR(A),
01728                                         so swap to RGB(A) for ALL MIPmap levels */
01729                                 for( i = 0; i < DDS_full_size; i += block_size )
01730                                 {
01731                                         unsigned char temp = DDS_data[i];
01732                                         DDS_data[i] = DDS_data[i+2];
01733                                         DDS_data[i+2] = temp;
01734                                 }
01735                                 glTexImage2D(
01736                                         cf_target, 0,
01737                                         S3TC_type, width, height, 0,
01738                                         S3TC_type, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, DDS_data );
01739                         } else
01740                         {
01741                                 soilGlCompressedTexImage2D(
01742                                         cf_target, 0,
01743                                         S3TC_type, width, height, 0,
01744                                         DDS_main_size, DDS_data );
01745                         }
01746                         /*      upload the mipmaps, if we have them     */
01747                         for( i = 1; i <= mipmaps; ++i )
01748                         {
01749                                 int w, h, mip_size;
01750                                 w = width >> i;
01751                                 h = height >> i;
01752                                 if( w < 1 )
01753                                 {
01754                                         w = 1;
01755                                 }
01756                                 if( h < 1 )
01757                                 {
01758                                         h = 1;
01759                                 }
01760                                 /*      upload this mipmap      */
01761                                 if( uncompressed )
01762                                 {
01763                                         mip_size = w*h*block_size;
01764                                         glTexImage2D(
01765                                                 cf_target, i,
01766                                                 S3TC_type, w, h, 0,
01767                                                 S3TC_type, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, &DDS_data[byte_offset] );
01768                                 } else
01769                                 {
01770                                         mip_size = ((w+3)/4)*((h+3)/4)*block_size;
01771                                         soilGlCompressedTexImage2D(
01772                                                 cf_target, i,
01773                                                 S3TC_type, w, h, 0,
01774                                                 mip_size, &DDS_data[byte_offset] );
01775                                 }
01776                                 /*      and move to the next mipmap     */
01777                                 byte_offset += mip_size;
01778                         }
01779                         /*      it worked!      */
01780                         result_string_pointer = "DDS file loaded";
01781                 } else
01782                 {
01783                         glDeleteTextures( 1, & tex_ID );
01784                         tex_ID = 0;
01785                         cf_target = ogl_target_end + 1;
01786                         result_string_pointer = "DDS file was too small for expected image data";
01787                 }
01788         }/* end reading each face */
01789         SOIL_free_image_data( DDS_data );
01790         if( tex_ID )
01791         {
01792                 /*      did I have MIPmaps?     */
01793                 if( mipmaps > 0 )
01794                 {
01795                         /*      instruct OpenGL to use the MIPmaps      */
01796                         glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, GL_TEXTURE_MAG_FILTER, GL_LINEAR );
01797                         glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, GL_TEXTURE_MIN_FILTER, GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR );
01798                 } else
01799                 {
01800                         /*      instruct OpenGL _NOT_ to use the MIPmaps        */
01801                         glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, GL_TEXTURE_MAG_FILTER, GL_LINEAR );
01802                         glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, GL_TEXTURE_MIN_FILTER, GL_LINEAR );
01803                 }
01804                 /*      does the user want clamping, or wrapping?       */
01805                 if( flags & SOIL_FLAG_TEXTURE_REPEATS )
01806                 {
01807                         glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_S, GL_REPEAT );
01808                         glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_T, GL_REPEAT );
01809                         glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, SOIL_TEXTURE_WRAP_R, GL_REPEAT );
01810                 } else
01811                 {
01812                         /*      unsigned int clamp_mode = SOIL_CLAMP_TO_EDGE;   */
01813                         unsigned int clamp_mode = GL_CLAMP;
01814                         glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_S, clamp_mode );
01815                         glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_T, clamp_mode );
01816                         glTexParameteri( opengl_texture_type, SOIL_TEXTURE_WRAP_R, clamp_mode );
01817                 }
01818         }
01819 
01820 quick_exit:
01821         /*      report success or failure       */
01822         return tex_ID;
01823 }
01824 
01825 unsigned int SOIL_direct_load_DDS(
01826                 const char *filename,
01827                 unsigned int reuse_texture_ID,
01828                 int flags,
01829                 int loading_as_cubemap )
01830 {
01831         FILE *f;
01832         unsigned char *buffer;
01833         size_t buffer_length, bytes_read;
01834         unsigned int tex_ID = 0;
01835         /*      error checks    */
01836         if( NULL == filename )
01837         {
01838                 result_string_pointer = "NULL filename";
01839                 return 0;
01840         }
01841         f = fopen( filename, "rb" );
01842         if( NULL == f )
01843         {
01844                 /*      the file doesn't seem to exist (or be open-able)        */
01845                 result_string_pointer = "Can not find DDS file";
01846                 return 0;
01847         }
01848         fseek( f, 0, SEEK_END );
01849         buffer_length = ftell( f );
01850         fseek( f, 0, SEEK_SET );
01851         buffer = (unsigned char *) malloc( buffer_length );
01852         if( NULL == buffer )
01853         {
01854                 result_string_pointer = "malloc failed";
01855                 fclose( f );
01856                 return 0;
01857         }
01858         bytes_read = fread( (void*)buffer, 1, buffer_length, f );
01859         fclose( f );
01860         if( bytes_read < buffer_length )
01861         {
01862                 /*      huh?    */
01863                 buffer_length = bytes_read;
01864         }
01865         /*      now try to do the loading       */
01866         tex_ID = SOIL_direct_load_DDS_from_memory(
01867                 (const unsigned char *const)buffer, buffer_length,
01868                 reuse_texture_ID, flags, loading_as_cubemap );
01869         SOIL_free_image_data( buffer );
01870         return tex_ID;
01871 }
01872 
01873 int query_NPOT_capability( void )
01874 {
01875         /*      check for the capability        */
01876         if( has_NPOT_capability == SOIL_CAPABILITY_UNKNOWN )
01877         {
01878                 /*      we haven't yet checked for the capability, do so        */
01879                 if(
01880                         (NULL == strstr( (char const*)glGetString( GL_EXTENSIONS ),
01881                                 "GL_ARB_texture_non_power_of_two" ) )
01882                         )
01883                 {
01884                         /*      not there, flag the failure     */
01885                         has_NPOT_capability = SOIL_CAPABILITY_NONE;
01886                 } else
01887                 {
01888                         /*      it's there!     */
01889                         has_NPOT_capability = SOIL_CAPABILITY_PRESENT;
01890                 }
01891         }
01892         /*      let the user know if we can do non-power-of-two textures or not */
01893         return has_NPOT_capability;
01894 }

01896 int query_tex_rectangle_capability( void )
01897 {
01898         /*      check for the capability        */
01899         if( has_tex_rectangle_capability == SOIL_CAPABILITY_UNKNOWN )
01900         {
01901                 /*      we haven't yet checked for the capability, do so        */
01902                 if(
01903                         (NULL == strstr( (char const*)glGetString( GL_EXTENSIONS ),
01904                                 "GL_ARB_texture_rectangle" ) )
01905                 &&
01906                         (NULL == strstr( (char const*)glGetString( GL_EXTENSIONS ),
01907                                 "GL_EXT_texture_rectangle" ) )
01908                 &&
01909                         (NULL == strstr( (char const*)glGetString( GL_EXTENSIONS ),
01910                                 "GL_NV_texture_rectangle" ) )
01911                         )
01912                 {
01913                         /*      not there, flag the failure     */
01914                         has_tex_rectangle_capability = SOIL_CAPABILITY_NONE;
01915                 } else
01916                 {
01917                         /*      it's there!     */
01918                         has_tex_rectangle_capability = SOIL_CAPABILITY_PRESENT;
01919                 }
01920         }
01921         /*      let the user know if we can do texture rectangles or not        */
01922         return has_tex_rectangle_capability;
01923 }

01950 
01951 int query_DXT_capability( void )
01952 {
01953         /*      check for the capability        */
01954         if( has_DXT_capability == SOIL_CAPABILITY_UNKNOWN )
01955         {
01956                 /*      we haven't yet checked for the capability, do so        */
01957                 if( NULL == strstr(
01958                                 (char const*)glGetString( GL_EXTENSIONS ),
01959                                 "GL_EXT_texture_compression_s3tc" ) )
01960                 {
01961                         /*      not there, flag the failure     */
01962                         has_DXT_capability = SOIL_CAPABILITY_NONE;
01963                 } else
01964                 {
01965                         /*      and find the address of the extension function  */
01966                         P_SOIL_GLCOMPRESSEDTEXIMAGE2DPROC ext_addr = NULL;
01967                         #ifdef WIN32
01968                                 ext_addr = (P_SOIL_GLCOMPRESSEDTEXIMAGE2DPROC)
01969                                                 wglGetProcAddress
01970                                                 (
01971                                                         "glCompressedTexImage2DARB"
01972                                                 );
01973                         #elif defined(__APPLE__) || defined(__APPLE_CC__)
01974                                 /*      I can't test this Apple stuff!  */
01975                                 CFBundleRef bundle;
01976                                 CFURLRef bundleURL =
01977                                         CFURLCreateWithFileSystemPath(
01978                                                 kCFAllocatorDefault,
01979                                                 CFSTR("/System/Library/Frameworks/OpenGL.framework"),
01980                                                 kCFURLPOSIXPathStyle,
01981                                                 true );
01982                                 CFStringRef extensionName =
01983                                         CFStringCreateWithCString(
01984                                                 kCFAllocatorDefault,
01985                                                 "glCompressedTexImage2DARB",
01986                                                 kCFStringEncodingASCII );
01987                                 bundle = CFBundleCreate( kCFAllocatorDefault, bundleURL );
01988                                 assert( bundle != NULL );
01989                                 ext_addr = (P_SOIL_GLCOMPRESSEDTEXIMAGE2DPROC)
01990                                                 CFBundleGetFunctionPointerForName
01991                                                 (
01992                                                         bundle, extensionName
01993                                                 );
01994                                 CFRelease( bundleURL );
01995                                 CFRelease( extensionName );
01996                                 CFRelease( bundle );
01997                         #else
01998                                 ext_addr = (P_SOIL_GLCOMPRESSEDTEXIMAGE2DPROC)
01999                                                 glXGetProcAddressARB
02000                                                 (
02001                                                         (const GLubyte *)"glCompressedTexImage2DARB"
02002                                                 );
02003                         #endif
02004                         /*      Flag it so no checks needed later       */
02005                         if( NULL == ext_addr )
02006                         {
02007                                 /*      hmm, not good!!  This should not happen, but does on my
02008                                         laptop's VIA chipset.  The GL_EXT_texture_compression_s3tc
02009                                         spec requires that ARB_texture_compression be present too.
02010                                         this means I can upload and have the OpenGL drive do the
02011                                         conversion, but I can't use my own routines or load DDS files
02012                                         from disk and upload them directly [8^( */
02013                                 has_DXT_capability = SOIL_CAPABILITY_NONE;
02014                         } else
02015                         {
02016                                 /*      all's well!     */
02017                                 soilGlCompressedTexImage2D = ext_addr;
02018                                 has_DXT_capability = SOIL_CAPABILITY_PRESENT;
02019                         }
02020                 }
02021         }
02022         /*      let the user know if we can do DXT or not       */
02023         return has_DXT_capability;
02024 }
